title: Spinach lasagne
author: Stoyan & Lora
steps: For the béchamel, fry the flour until golden in the heated butter.

Gradually, stirring constantly, pour in the milk. Cook until the sauce thickens slightly. It should remain slightly thinner than usual because the crusts are uncooked and will absorb the liquid. Turn off the heat and season with the mustard, salt and pepper.
Saute the onion and garlic and fry them in the olive oil until soft and glassy.
Pour boiling water over the spinach to soften. Then cool it under cold running water and drain very well, squeezing it with your hands. Chop it finely.
Mix the spinach, grated Parmesan, crumbled gorgonzola and ricotta. Mix well. Add the fried onion and garlic, eggs, nutmeg, salt and pepper to taste and mix well again.

Pour the bechamel on the bottom of the baking dish. Arrange the lasagne crusts on top. Pour over the béchamel, sprinkle over some of the spinach mixture and arrange the mozzarella slices. Alternate in this way until you run out of products. Finish with the crusts, béchamel and mozzarella.
Preheat the oven to 180 degrees with a fan. Bake the lasagne for 40 minutes. Allow to cool slightly, cut and serve.

title: Chicken in bacon
author: Stoyan & Lora
steps: The chicken fillets are split with a knife to form pockets and salted.
Mix the minced garlic with the mustard, cottage cheese, sour cream and salt to taste.
Fill the fillets with the mixture.
Wrap each piece in strips of bacon.
Bake for about 15 minutes at 220 degrees in a baking dish covered with parchment paper.

title: Kaiserschmarrn
author: Kris
steps: To make this delicious Kaiserschmarrn, first mix the flour, sugar, salt and egg yolks with the milk in a bowl to form a smooth, thick batter.
In another bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff and then fold into the thick batter.
Foam the butter in a large, shallow pan (Ø 22-24 cm) so that it is very hot, slowly pour in the batter and fry on both sides using a spatula.
Then remove the pan from the boiler and tear the finished dough into irregular pieces with two spoons.
Now add the raisins, mix well and place the pan back оn the boiler for approx. 1 minute while still hot.
Arrange the pancakes on plates, sprinkle with sugar and serve with any compote or apple mousse.

title: Carrot cake
author: Yoli
steps: Beat the eggs with the sugar to a fluffy cream and add the orange juice. Fold in the carrots, vanilla and orange zest.

Mix the flour together with the spices, the two types of raising agent and the raisins. Judge the quantities of spices according to your taste. Add it to the egg mixture and mix. Finally, pour in the oil and mix everything well.

Pour the batter into a 22 or 24 cm cake tin, covered with baking paper (if you want the marshmallows to be thinner, bake the batter in a larger tin). Preheat the oven to 180* and bake the marshmallows for about 35-40 minutes. Once well cooled cut it horizontally into three parts.
For the cream, beat the cream cheese with the sugar, vanilla and orange zest. Add the cream and mix.
Assemble the cake by spreading a layer of cream between each carrot cake.  Spread the cream all over the sides and top of the cake. Smooth and decorate as desired. Enjoy!

title: Potato cream soup
author: Osata
steps: Peel the potatoes, carrot and onion. Cut the potatoes and carrots into chunks.
Put them in a saucepan and cook them in the chicken stock until tender.
When you can poke them easily with a fork, the vegetables are fairly cooked.
Remove the cooked vegetables and blend until a homogeneous mixture is obtained.
Add to the resulting mixture the butter, fresh milk and the broth in which the vegetables were cooked.
Toss well, add salt and pepper to taste and boil the potato cream soup for a few more minutes.
While the soup is boiling, prepare the croutons. Cut the bread slices into cubes and place in a suitable baking dish and sprinkle with the spices.
Pour the olive oil over them, toss well and bake for 8-10 minutes in a preheated oven at 200 degrees, basting every 2-3 minutes.
The potato cream soup is served hot with the croutons.

title: Turkish red lentil soup
author: Stoyan & Lora
steps: Cut the peeled carrot, onion and garlic into cubes. Heat the olive oil in a multicooker or saucepan, salt and fry them until soft.
Add the tomato concentrate, the pre-washed red lentils, the stock, the crushed cumin and salt.
Close the multicooker and cook for 12 minutes on a 40 kilo pan or about 20 minutes if using a saucepan.
Transfer the finished soup to a blender and blend. Serve with sliced lemon, chopped fresh parsley and a drizzle of olive oil.

title: Classical pancakes
author: Nati & Kris
steps: In a deep bowl break the eggs. Beat with the salt and vanilla.
Add the milk with stirring.
Gradually add the flour mixed with baking powder. Stir until the mixture is homogeneous.
Add the oil.
Heat the pan and put very little oil. Put less than 1 ladle of the mixture and cook until the edges separate. Flip and cook gently on the other side.

title: Belgian waffles
author: Iliyan
steps: Мelt the butter in a water bath and leave to rest briefly in the fridge.
In a bowl, combine flour, sugar and baking powder.
In another bowl, lightly beat egg yolks.
Add milk, butter and vanilla and mix well.
Stir into dry ingredients just until combined.
Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form, fold into batter.
Bake in a preheated waffle iron accoring to manufacturer's directions until golden brown.
Serve with some berries or syrop.

title: Quesadilla with poached egg
author: Andre Tokev
steps: Slice the mozzarella and tomatoes and arrange them on the flatbread.
Chop the basil and chives and mix them together. Put them on top of the quesadilla.
Heat a pan and put olive oil in it. Fry the quesadilla from both sides.
Cut the avocado into cubes and season with lime, olive oil and salt.
Heat water and add the vinegar. Water should not boil but only simmer.
Put the egg in a small bowl. Stir the water like a whirlpool. Pour the egg into the centre and cook for 3 minutes.
Serve the quesadilla cut in half with the avocado, warmed tomatoes and the egg sprinkled with paprika on top.

title: Fluffy pancakes
author: Rowe
steps: Beat the egg whites into foam.
Sift the flour. Mix with baking powder.
Place the ricotta, milk and egg yolks in a bowl. Whip with a whisk.
Mix dry ingredients slowly into the baffer, again with a whisk and then with a spoon.
Add the beaten egg whites to the baffer, mix very slowly with a spoon.
Heat a pan on average temperature, then add butter or/and oil. Put 2 spoons of batter for each pancake. Make space between each pancake.
When bubbles appear flip the pancake.

title: Stefani roll
author: Nati
steps: The first and most essential step of the recipe for roll Stefani is the preparation of the products. Boil the carrots for about 10 minutes, and in the meantime prepare the minced meat. You can use either pork or veal mince to make a stefani roll, and it is best to use a mixture of minces. While you are preparing the mince, boil three of the eggs. Add the salt and spices, and two raw eggs. You soak the slices in water and once they are completely soft you crumble them and add them to the mince as well. You grate the onion, chop the parsley very finely and add them to the bowl. And you start mixing with your hands. Knead thoroughly to distribute all the ingredients evenly. You leave the mince aside.

Cut the cooked carrots and cucumbers into strips. Peel the eggs and cut them into quarters. The mince should be spread out in a rectangular shape about 1 cm thick and approximately the width of the baking tray in which you will bake the roll (for example 35 cm by 25 cm). At the top of the wide side of the minced 'marsh', arrange a row of carrots, underneath a row of pickled cucumbers and finally a row of boiled and quartered eggs. Don't try to roll the roll with your hands, as the mince 'swamp' will break. Therefore, grasp the towel at the top end where the vegetables are arranged and, in one movement, 'tuck' and roll down. Repeat the movement until you have rolled the whole roll. Finally, press both ends of the roll to "seal" and keep the filling from coming out when baking.

You need a large baking tray to bake a Stephanie roll, it is best to use the oven trays as the roll is quite long. Place baking paper in the tray (this will save you the effort of washing the tray later) and place the roll on top. Bake the stefani roll in a preheated oven at 180 degrees for 40-45 minutes.

title: Spaghetti chicken
author: Nati & Kris
steps: Cut the onion into cubes and put in a pan with hot oil.
Add the bacon and the seasoned chicken to the mix.
Put the dried corn and the sliced dill. Pour the cooking cream and cook for a few minutes.
Meanwhile, cook the spaghetti.
Serve the spaghetti on a deep plate with the sauce and shredded cheese on top. Enjoy!

title: Chicken popcorn
author: Stoyan & Lora
steps: Cut the meat into cubes and season it with oregano, dried garlic, paprika, thyme, salt and olive oil. Refrigerate for 30 minutes.

Put the bread in a blender and grind it into crumbs. Pour them into a shallow baking dish and bake them in the oven at 180 degrees for about 8 minutes. Remove and cool. Mix the crumbs with the grated Parmesan.
Roll the chicken in flour, dip in beaten eggs and coat with breadcrumbs and parmesan. Cook the bites in an airfryer for 10-15 minutes or fry them in a pan in an oil bath.
Make the sauce by mixing the yoghurt with the crushed garlic, honey and mustard. Serve the bites with the sauce and mixed salad greens.

title: Roasted chicken chimichanga
author: Stoyan & Lora
steps: Cut the chicken into thin pieces and fry in the hot oil along with the chopped onion and garlic.
Add the diced tomato and chopped chilli. Season with cumin, smoked paprika, chili powder, salt and pepper, and after 1-2 minutes pull from the heat.
Mix the finished stuffing with the grated Cheddar cheese and the sour cream.
Spread the tortillas with melted butter.
In the middle of each put the filling and close like packets.
Arrange in a non-stick pan. Brush the top with butter. Bake in a preheated oven at 180 degrees with a fan until ready - about 15 minutes.
Mash the avocado and season with the garlic, salt and lime juice. Dice the tomatoes and mix with the chopped onion, coriander and chilli.Season with salt and pepper.
Each serving of chimichanga is served with avocado, tomatoes, sour cream and optional shredded Cheddar cheese.

title: Butter chicken masala
author: Stoyan & Lora
steps: Blend the garlic cloves and ginger with the lemon juice, yogurt, garam masala, red pepper, curcuma, cinnamon and salt to taste.
Mix the meat with the mixture and leave to marinate overnight. It is then removed from the marinade and cooked in an oiled grill pan on both sides - until half done.
Remove and cut into cubes.
Chop the garlic for the sauce and fry in heated oil. Sprinkle the garam masala, red pepper and cashews. Stir.
Add the tomato concentrate, the blended tomatoes and season with salt.
Pour 200 ml of water and boil the sauce for 15 minutes over low heat. Blend and strain.
Put back on the heat and stir in the meat.
Pour the cream. The dish is simmered for 10 minutes and salted.
Serve with rice cooked in water with a little salt and chopped coriander.

title: Mustard Chicken
author: Beni
steps: I cleaned, washed, dried and rubbed the thighs with a mixture of 80 g of the mustard, mixed with ground pepper and salt. I put them in a suitable container, covered with a piece of cling film for fresh storage and left in the fridge overnight. In the original recipe, they stand for 1 hour.

In a wide and deep frying pan I heated 2 tablespoons of butter and 1 tablespoon of oil and fried the chopped onion, salting it lightly and adding the thyme. When they got an appetizing tan, I removed them to a plate.

I added just a little more oil to the pan and put the thighs in with the mustard on them. I fried them on both sides until nicely browned. Even though my pan is ceramic, some of the mixture stuck, which is not a problem.

The finished sealed legs I transferred to the plate with the onions and thyme, and in the pan I put the wine and 150 ml. water. I brought to the boil, using a silicone spatula to help separate any chicken or mustard stuck to the bottom.
I turned the heat down to 3 from 6 on my stove and returned the thighs, onions and thyme.

Since I don't have a lid for this pan, I covered it with a piece of aluminum foil and cooked for a little over 1 hour, or until the chicken was completely done. During cooking, I turned the thighs 4-5 times to cook evenly. If there is almost no sauce left in the pan, a little more hot water can be added.

I mixed the 20 g of mustard with the sour cream and 2 tablespoons of lukewarm water. To this mixture I added a little of the sauce to the dish and when it was homogenised I returned it to the pan, not basting the meat but mixing it with the sauce. I brought it to a boil and turned off the heat, allowing the dish to cook a little more. It shouldn't cook more than 2-3 minutes because the sauce will thicken.
Meanwhile I prepared the rice.

I washed the rice and drained it in a sieve colander. I boiled 900 ml. water. In a medium saucepan I heated 2 tbsp oil and 1 tbsp butter. I added the rice and salt to taste, stirred and fried until the grains visibly began to seal. When that happened, I removed the pot from the heat and added all the boiling water. I stirred, returned it to the stove, and turned the heat down to 3 from 6.

I cooked without a lid until the rice had completely absorbed the liquid, stirring occasionally. When the liquid was absorbed, I removed the pot from the heat, covered it with two layers of kitchen paper and put the lid on. This steams the rice and the paper absorbs any excess liquid. A cotton cloth can also be used for this purpose.

I arranged the rice on the plates, which I had previously placed and sealed well in a buttered glass. Then I added the thighs and poured the sauce over them. I finished with chopped parsley and a sprig of thyme on top of the rice. Bon appetit!
